title: Bob Moses (rugby league)
text:
Robert Lindsay "Bob" Moses (26 July 1940 – 21 December 2017) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He was a dual premiership winning player at the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>.
Playing career.
Moses originated from <a href="Newcastle%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newcastle, New South Wales</a>, and signed with <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> in 1965. He played in the <a href="1965%20NSWRFL%20season">1965 Grand Final</a> for Souths, but they were defeated by <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George</a> 12-8. He went on to play six seasons with <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> between 1965-1970. He played in three more grand finals for Souths, winning the <a href="1967%20NSWRFL%20season">1967 Grand Final</a> and <a href="1968%20NSWRFL%20season">1968 Grand Final</a> and played in the <a href="1969%20NSWRFL%20season">1969 Grand Final</a> loss to <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain</a>. 
By 1970, he was in reserve grade and his Souths career was over. He moved to <a href="Manly-Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly-Warringah</a> for three seasons between 1971-1973 but injury curtailed his career at Manly. He did not feature in any other Grand Finals before retiring. 
Later life.
He later became a successful publican in the <a href="Penrith%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Penrith</a> area. Moses death was announced on 21 December 2017.
